content.text: Different sources of electromagnetic noise exist in the vicinity of airports.

Navigation emitters (e.g. Instrument Landing System) and radar (e.g. air traffic control, air and surface  search, airborne systems) produce high frequency electric fields and large peak pulse powers in a wide  zone.
For mitigation techniques see Annex A.
Care shall be taken to minimise any emissions which could affect navigation systems (e.g. landing systems).
